title: Rivada Space Networks selects Aalyria Spacetime
summary: Aalyria, the company marketing technology developed by Google parent Alphabet, announced an agreement March 13 with Rivada Space Networks.

title: LeoLabs to build  radar in Argentina
summary: LeoLabs is expanding observation over the Southern Hemisphere with a radar in Argentina.

title: CesiumAstro enters IFC market
summary: CesiumAstro is entering the in-flight connectivity market with demonstrations on Airbus airplanes and helicopters.

title: NASA study assess costs and benefits of orbital debris removal
summary: A NASA study concluded that some methods of removing orbital debris could pay for themselves within a decade by reducing the costs and risks borne by satellite operators.

title: Russia Lofts Luch Relay Satellite Aboard Proton Rocket
summary: In the early hours of the morning, the Russian space agency, Roscosmos, successfully launched a Proton-M rocket with a Briz-M upper stage carrying the Luch-5X spacecraft. The launch took place at 02:12:59.981 Moscow time from the 200th site of the Baikonur Cosmodrome, Kazakhstan.
